data.title: Portland actor Danny Bruno -- aka Bud the Eisbiber -- returns for more 'Grimm' webisodes
data.meta_description: Danny Bruno has made an impression as the easily flustered beaver-like creature -- who also happens to be a big fan of the Oregon State Beavers -- in "Grimm." But in a new Webisode, Bud the Eisbiber is in big trouble.
data.text:
One_Angry_Fuchsbau_Danny_Bruno_-_Grimm-0.jpg

Portland actor Danny Bruno is back in another Webisode as Bud the Eisbiber on the "Grimm" Website.

Portland actor Danny Bruno has made quite an impression among

fans for his performance as Bud Wurstner, the Eisbiber Wesen who occasionally pops up in need of help from

In his human form, Bud is the easily flustered but friendly refrigerator repairman who's a diehard fan of the Oregon State Beavers.

In his Wesen form, Bud's a toothy beaver-like creature -- which could hardly be more fitting for a show that's filmed and set in Portland, Oregon. In case you just moved here from some remote backwater and didn't know, the

and our nickname is the "Beaver State."

Bruno has made Bud an industrious, bubbly sort. So it's only natural that he should get a little extra screen time in Webisodes made for the "Grimm" Web site.

with

and

Now there's a new clip up on the site, titled "Meltdown: Deep Freeze." Apparently, this is supposed to be happening while the Scooby Gang were in the shipyard, on the trail of zombies, at the end of last season. That particular adventure unfortunately culminated in Nick being turned into a zombie. Or so the promos for Season 3, which airs Oct. 25, on NBC (8), are making us believe.

Bud gets a knock on his office door. It's

and Sgt. Franco (Portland actor Robert Blanche). Seems there's been some strange activity in the area, Wu deadpans. When isn't there strange activity in the "Grimm" vision of Portland? Has Bud heard anything about it, Wu wonders? Bud gets a little flustered -- as usual -- and says his wife's been calling him about dinner, but otherwise there's nothing going on.

Wu takes his "Dragnet"-style, just-the-facts-mister leave, followed by Franco. Inside his workplace, Bud discovers a real reason to get flustered -- a zombie-like creature is breaking in, and going after the fridge fixer.

In a panic, Bud locks himself into a hiding place. Is it a refrigerated compartment? Unfortunately, his keys and his cell phone are locked outside, where the zombie is, trying to break down the locked door.

Which is where we leave our friendly neighborhood Eisbiber. How is he going to get out of this? Since the "Grimm" site has a headline over a photo of Bruno that reads,

"Wu vs. the Zombies,"

I have a feeling we'll be seeing the good Sergeant coming back for some zombie-fu action.

-- Kristi Turnquist
